channel.title: Bad Words
channel.description: In Delta, the bad words are blocked out by 3 stars (*) I know how to remove the bad words, and how to change the amount of stars, but the thing is, lets say some one says ass, it will replace it with ***, if some one says fuck, it will replace it with ***K. See what I mean? Lets say some one says bitch it would replace it with ****H, etc. I want it so I can replace ass with ***, replace fuck with ****, replace nigger with ******, instead of ****Er or ***Ger, so please help me. Also, give specific instructions, like if there is server side included (highly doubt, just an example) don't just say do it yourself, because I don't know what I'm going. Thank you.

item.title: Bad Words
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“GrimReapersScythe, post:6, topic:306922”]Try public final void method73(int i) { for(int james = [i]; james < badWords.length; james++) { String bad = badWords[james]; if(aString887.contains(bad)) aString887 = aString887.replaceAll(badWords[james], "***"); }
or

public final void method73(int i) { for(int james = 0; james < badWords.length; james++) { String bad = badWords[james]; if(aString887.contains(bad)) aString887 = aString887.replaceAll(badWords[james], "**********"); }

One of them should work, not tested though, so I wouldn’t know. Just try and tell me how it goes.[/quote]
first one was an error all the second one does is replace all the words with **********

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Words
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

Try public final void method73(int i) { for(int james = [i]; james < badWords.length; james++) { String bad = badWords[james]; if(aString887.contains(bad)) aString887 = aString887.replaceAll(badWords[james], "***"); }
or

public final void method73(int i) { for(int james = 0; james < badWords.length; james++) { String bad = badWords[james]; if(aString887.contains(bad)) aString887 = aString887.replaceAll(badWords[james], "**********"); }

One of them should work, not tested though, so I wouldn’t know. Just try and tell me how it goes.

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Words
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

Okay, this is what I get when I search badWord

public final void method73(int i) { for(int james = 0; james < badWords.length; james++) { String bad = badWords[james]; if(aString887.contains(bad)) aString887 = aString887.replaceAll(badWords[james], "***"); }
and

public String badWords[] = {"fuck", "shit" };

Notice the aString887 = aString887.replaceAll(badWords[james], “***”); It only replaces fuck, shit, and ass with *** so fuck and shit would be ***K and ***T and ass would be ***. I want fuck and shit to be **** and ass to remain ***.

Get me?

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Words
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

Your client is only recognizing 3-4 characters of each word in the ‘badwords’ string. The ‘badwords’ string is the string in your client loading the list of bad words. Look for the loading of the list, to replace it with stars, and replace the whole method, with A for loop.

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Words
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“GrimReapersScythe, post:2, topic:306922”]Your client is only recognizing 3-4 chars of each word, in the ‘badword’ string, to replace.
Try replacing it with A for loop.[/quote]
what??

Read full topic

Your client is only recognizing 3-4 chars of each word, in the ‘badword’ string, to replace.
Try replacing it with A for loop.
